sub_topic: Calculating the heat of formation of a molecule
message_1: What is the heat of formation of methane (CH4) assuming standard conditions (25°C and 1 atm pressure)?
message_2:
The heat of formation (ΔHf°) of a compound is the change in enthalpy during the formation of 1 mole of the substance from its constituent elements, with all substances in their standard states at 25°C and 1 atm pressure.

For methane (CH4), the heat of formation (ΔHf°) is -74.8 kJ/mol. This means that 74.8 kJ of energy is released when 1 mole of methane is formed from its constituent elements (carbon and hydrogen) under standard conditions.
